An das Wort des Buddha habe ich mich erinnert und [an das] des Ānanda.
The speech of the Buddha I remembered and [I also remembered the speech] of Ānanda.
... führten sie ihn zur Untersuchung [bzw. ins Gericht], [und] die Richter sprachen:
... they led him to the investigation [or: to court), and the judges said:

Translation [[Ogihara 2009]]: 371-372:
a1 /// he gained a lot of possessions. The king heard and ordered to arrest this man. They made much pain to (him).
a2 /// Thereafter, he said: '(Here is) an venomous snake, O Ānanda. (Here is) an fearful poison, O Venerable'. He did not say any other word. (The king heard)
a3 /// I remembered the speech of Buddha and Ānanda, and I said thus the speech of Buddha telling a decision to Ānanda: '(Here is) [an venomous snake,] (O Ānanda. Here is an fearful poison, O Venerable'.)
a4 /// (the king) gave (him five hundred denarius). || Buddha was staying in Vaiśālī. A lot of princes of Vaiśālī at the gates of the gardens
a5 /// they threw a thousand denarius on the road in order to test this man. They remained in a separate direction (=distant place).
b1 /// [they blamed him] and led him to the court. The judges said: 'The monks belonging to Śākya are not worthy of (doing a thing of this type.)'
b2 /// Buddha heard this affair and blamed. || Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī. In Śrāvastī, a certain woman,
b3 /// (Mṛgāramātṛ) wore the ornament (the value of five hundred denarius) and went out to the forest in order to enjoy herself. Thereupon, she turned back from the forest and went to Jetavana. (In order to see) Buddha
b4 /// Because of the belief (while) hearing the law, this maid-servant forgot ornaments there. [Buddha], knowing
b5 /// By this affair, Buddha gave the opportunity for the prescription. If a jewel is found inside the monastery, it should be taken up with this thought


[[Broomhead I]]: 103 translates:

a1 He made many possessions. When the king heard [this] he ordered this man to be beaten. They gave him much pain.

a2 Thereupon he spoke. "O Ananda, a terrible poison, O Lord, a fearful poison!" The latter did not manage however to say a single word.

a3 I remembered the Buddha's word, and Ananda. Resolutely spoken is the word of the Buddha. Therefore I said ...

a4 He gave ...: The Buddha was in Vaiśāli. On the way [in] the Vaiśāli pinces at the gates of [their] gardens [stood looking]

a5 For the sake of repeating this [and] they threw a thousand dinars on the road. These completely ...

b1 They led him into an interrogation. The interrogators said. The Śākya monks are not worthy to [do] thus.

b2 The Buddha heard this thing and scolded them. The Buddha was in Śrāvasti. In Śrāvasti another [female] ...

b3 had put on a jewel [and] had gon into the wood in order to revel. Then she came out of the wood and went into Jetavana. The Buddha went ...

b4 The female slave hearing the law with faith forgot there and then the jewelry. Knowing [this] the Buddha ...

>b5 With regard to this matter the Buddha gave the ruling in a śikṣāpada. If a jewel is found inside a monastery [itis] to be taken in this spirit.
